page.title: 20OVER WYRESDALE:TOURISM
page.content:
Although this area is very attractive it is rarely visited by tourists except on their way to the Trough of Bowland. Tourism is not encouraged. There are no hotels or guesthouses and only one cottage ever let for holiday bookings. There are no pubs or even tea-rooms. On the other hand footpaths are well-marked and used regularly by local ramblers with whom farmers have a good relationship.
______________________________________
Compiled by Mrs Jean Johnson, Mrs Sue Jenkins, Mrs Jean Mussell and Mrs Nellie Gorst on behalf of Dolphinholme Women's Institute with very grateful thanks to all those who gave up their time to answer our questions and to help us write this report.
